title: Europeans have followed Brits and fallen in love with online shopping
text:
Germany’s service sector along with its manufacturing powerhouse weakened in September and the European Central Bank is running low on firepower – so many on the Continent are hoping that the European Union will strike a deal with Britain to help the whole of Europe to avoid the economic consequences of a no-deal Brexit.

A China-United States-European Union trade war, while not yet in full swing, is already hitting the mighty German automotive industry, and American tariffs are predicted to cost 100,000 European jobs in the cheese, wine and olive oil sectors.

But in the arena of shopping and retail-related real estate, there are even bigger, structural issues at play – both in the UK and on the...
description: Germany’s service sector along with its manufacturing powerhouse weakened in September and the European Central Bank is running low on firepower – so many on the Continent are hoping that the European Union will strike a deal with Britain to help the whole of Europe to avoid the economic consequences of a no-deal Brexit.
